timeline.message:
Compress metric unites defensively

The units of the metrics are directly derived from the ProbeUnit enum
and the MetricCompressor takes the ordinal when creating the blob. On
the consumer side this ordinal is taken and a lookup is made with the
ordinal potentially leading to IndexOutOfBoundsException if the ordinal
is higher than the size of the array holding the possible values of the
units. This can be the case every time we add a new unit to the
ProbeUnit enum, which the MetricCompressor is not aware of.

To prevent potential issues, we make the unit compression and extraction
more defensive. We change the compression to convert the marked units to
a tag with name "metric-unit" and set the unit to null. With this the
metric can still be processed by MC and the consumers using an metric
extractor and retain the information about the unit. The extractor is
made more defensive by adding a bound check to prevent the
IndexOutOfBoundsException in the mentioned case.

timeline.bodyText: Can we safely delete the argument in 4.3? That's probably a question on MC forward-compatibility with IMDG.
timeline.author: puzpuzpuz
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -36,4 +34,26 @@
     BOOLEAN,
     /** 0..n, ordinal of an enum */
     ENUM,
+    /** Timestamp or duration represented in µs */
+    // RU_COMPAT_4_2
+    // remove constructor argument in 4.3

replies.bodyText: I think if MC handles the units as @emre commented, we can delete the argument safely.
replies.author: blazember

replies.bodyText: I considered the same question and I think yes. We will upgrade MC to latest minor release when it comes out.
replies.author: emre-aydin

timeline.bodyText: nit: I'd also add a note to the enum javadoc. The text could be Note. The order of enum ordinals is important for compatibility purposes with potential metrics consumers. Do not delete existing value and always add new ones to the end of the list. or smth like that.
timeline.author: puzpuzpuz
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -36,4 +34,26 @@
     BOOLEAN,
     /** 0..n, ordinal of an enum */
     ENUM,
+    /** Timestamp or duration represented in µs */
+    // RU_COMPAT_4_2
+    // remove constructor argument in 4.3
+    US(true);

replies.bodyText: Thanks for the comment, added the above roles to the javadoc of the enum.
